c. Audio Services - The college should provide well equipped space for tape
and disc recording and re-recording. Colleges mil want to produce tape program
materials for classroom instruction on campus and also educational and public
information programs for release on radio stations.
Many universities are establishing tape recording libraries, where masters
of prerecorded programs on many different topics are filed. These are available
for servicing the campus and also all schools mthin the college service area.
Schools desiring a specific tape program send a blank tape with a request to
the library. A re-recording is made from the master tape and shipped to the
person requesting it. Usually a small service charge is made. These ”Tapes
for Teaching” libraries offer unlimited opportunity for service to schools,
